Description
JOIN OUR TEAM

Join the Procurement Analytics Center of Excellence (PACE), TELUS and support our mission to transform the chief procurement office (CPO) to a fully digital organization where data is at the heart of every decision we make. Enable stakeholders to efficiently evolve and consume actionable insights through transformation strategy.

We are an advanced data and AI team thriving on solving business problems and supporting procurement decisions using the power of data, advanced analytics, and reliable software. We provide end to end support from strategy and development to deployment and monitoring of all assets, including machine learning model, Tableau dashboards and data engineering ETLs using cutting edge Cloud technologies (e.g., Google BigQuery and GCP AI Platform), open source tools (e.g., Python, Sklearn, NLTK, Tensorflow), and enterprise products (e.g., Tableau, GitHub, Terraform).

In achieving our goal to enable data-driven decision making in CPO, PACE team is looking for an experienced data scientist who is able to regularly engage and interact with our business stakeholders to identify opportunities and develop complete solutions to turn data into insight for decision making.

What you’ll do:

As an experienced Data Scientist in PACE’s Insight Generation group, you will be at the front end, systematically analyzing and transforming vast amounts of tabular and unstructured data into actionable insights that are impactful in several ways to enable the organization to achieve their goals. We expect you to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen our data driven decision-making culture, improve the customer experience leading to revenue growth, cost reduction, and improved efficiency. You will be responsible to:

Work closely with business stakeholders to learn about data issues and insight gaps and take action to fill the gap
Work with the ‘Insight Generation ’ group within PACE and develop strategy for reporting, storytelling, and insight generation
Proactively looking at opportunities to blend data from across different enterprise systems to generate actionable insights that drive business value
Leverage innovative technologies and rigorous methods to extract, analyze, evaluate and interpret complex, multi-dimensional and constantly changing data
Question the status-quo and old processes, challenge assumptions, and advocate for AI and data-driven decision making across the chief procurement office
Influence PACE strategy and priorities while collaborating with other PACE team members to enable, design, develop, and deploy both data and visualization solutions
Mentor and coach other peers at PACE and upskill stakeholders to adopt and utilize reports, dashboards, and insights to inform day-to-day decision making
Provide technical coaching and mentoring to team members to ensure appropriate accessing, managing and interpretation of data

About Pani
Pani Energy is made up of a young team of highly motivated individuals who share a mutual passion for the environment. We have created a web-based platform which enables the operators of water treatment facilities to operate their plants more efficiently saving energy, consumables, water, and the environment. Our workplace environment fosters ingenuity and collaboration as we tackle challenging problems for the betterment of society.
Pani is part of the 2022 Global Cleantech 100 list of companies committed to acting on the climate crisis by focusing on the water industry, one of the largest industries in the world. We are accelerating that industry's transition to net zero carbon emissions, and we need driven, enthusiastic people who share this vision to help us succeed.
Position Description
As a Data Scientist you are a core member of a technical development team reporting to the Director of Engineering and Science. You will operate in a cross-functional team at the cutting edge of data science in the water industry. You will be involved in innovation through developing models and frameworks for a product that provides tangible value to the industry by changing the way water treatment plants are operated.
About You
You have a passion for data and enjoy working on tough problems with an equally talented group of co-workers who will both challenge and support you. You believe in lifelong learning and welcome the opportunity to constantly iterate and improve upon your skills. Fundamentally you want to use your talents and energy to better the world for others and contribute to global greenhouse gas reduction through the responsible management of global water and energy.
What you bring to the team
A Bachelor of Science (Computer Science) or a Bachelor of Engineering (Mechanical, Chemical, or Electrical) with 2 - 5 years of experience working in the field of data science OR a Master’s degree or higher in a related field
Expert knowledge of statistical and machine learning methods for forecasting and/or anomaly detection, especially on timeseries data. Preferred applicants will provide practical examples of applying these methods.
Experience with large datasets. Sufficient knowledge of relational databases to work efficiently with software and engineering partners
Fluency in Python and associated testing frameworks with a proven ability for writing code which is maintainable and scalable
Experience operating in Agile software development teams

Responsibilities
Lead internal data science modelling practices and collaborate with engineering modelers as part of a hybrid modeling approach to solve specific problems on real client data.
Build statistical models and machine learning inference systems using multiple data sources
Communicate findings derived from data clearly and concisely throughout the organization
Create visualizations, documentation, and requirements specifications to collaborate with product, software, and business stakeholders
Provide expertise on data science modelling techniques to other teams within the company
Contribute to maintaining a production-level codebase of models and modelling tools using tools such as Git, Docker, Jenkins, or similar.
Test and validate models, algorithms, and tooling against real-time client data to ship code at the global scale with confidence

Nice to Have
Experience in the water industry, ideally in water/wastewater treatment
Experience working for a SaaS startup
Working knowledge of thermodynamics, chemistry, or chemical engineering, especially as it pertains to water treatment
